key_findings: The Zapruder film is a crucial piece of evidence in understanding the sequence of events during the JFK assassination.
Multiple analyses focus on the timing and sequence of shots as captured in the film.
The film has been used to support both the single-bullet theory and the presence of multiple shooters.
consistent_information: The film captures the entire sequence of the assassination, providing a visual timeline.
Analyses agree on the film's importance in understanding the trajectory and timing of the shots.
contradictions: Some documents suggest the film was altered, while others maintain its authenticity.
Discrepancies exist regarding the number of shots and their origins as interpreted from the film.
potential_evidence: Allegations of film tampering have been raised, suggesting potential evidence of a coverup.
missing_information: Details on the chain of custody of the film post-assassination are incomplete.
Technical analysis of the film's authenticity is not fully documented in some sources.
assassination_theories: The film is central to theories involving a second shooter, particularly from the grassy knoll.
It is also used to challenge the single-bullet theory by showing the timing of shots.
